channel.title: Barrows Bug
channel.description:
When i or someone else on my server kills one of the barrow brothers, the whole server dc out and back in.
This error it says in the run.bat
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBound***ception: 0 at server.model.npcs.NPCHandler.dropItems<NPCHandler. java:2389> at server.model.npcs.NPCHandler.process<NPCHandler.ja va:2057> at server.Server.main<Server.java:163>

item.title: Barrows Bug
item.dc:creator: @CoderOops CoderOops
item.description:
@CoderOops wrote:

[quote=“Cres, post:9, topic:519971”]I still think that you’re trying to drop items from a list that isn’t even created.
Alter the code to check if the array is large enough or add some dummy drops to their drop tables.[/quote]

This was not problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Barrows Bug
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

I still think that you’re trying to drop items from a list that isn’t even created.
Alter the code to check if the array is large enough or add some dummy drops to their drop tables.

item.title: Barrows Bug
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

pindapoep:

What u mean?

Post the context of all 3 lines mentioned above and highlight them or indicate which line the error is pointing to.
May help us in finding the actual error. My geuss is that the server is trying to access the drops table for the barrows brothers but that they simply don’t have any elements in that table. (In other words, try giving some drops to your barrows brothers and see if the problem comes back).

Read full topic

item.title: Barrows Bug

item.description:
@Sessy_Pk3r wrote:

Try expanding the array above it. It should be a for statement like “for [i]+##” or something like that.

Read full topic

item.title: Barrows Bug
item.dc:creator: @pindapoep pindapoep
item.description:
@pindapoep wrote:

i already looked there but nothings wrong here’s the code

if (NPCDrops.dropRarity.get(npcs[i].npcType) != null) { if (rareDrops(i)) { try { int random = Misc.random(NPCDrops.rareDrops.get(npcs[i].npcType).length-1); if (c.CSLS == 3) { if (c.clanId >= 0) Server.clanChat.handleCoinShare(c, NPCDrops.rareDrops.get(npcs[i].npcType)[random][0], NPCDrops.rareDrops.get(npcs[i].npcType)[random][1]); return; } if (c.CSLS == 1) { if (c.clanId >= 0) Server.clanChat.handleLootShare(c, NPCDrops.rareDrops.get(npcs[i].npcType)[random][0], NPCDrops.rareDrops.get(npcs[i].npcType)[random][1]); Server.itemHandler.createGroundItem(c, NPCDrops.rareDrops.get(npcs[i].npcType)[random][0], npcs[i].absX, npcs[i].absY, NPCDrops.rareDrops.get(npcs[i].npcType)[random][1], c.playerId); return; } Server.itemHandler.createGroundItem(c, NPCDrops.rareDrops.get(npcs[i].npcType)[random][0], npcs[i].absX, npcs[i].absY, NPCDrops.rareDrops.get(npcs[i].npcType)[random][1], c.playerId); } catch(Exception ex) { ex.printStackTrace(); } } else { int random = Misc.random(NPCDrops.normalDrops.get(npcs[i].npcType).length-1); 
	Server.itemHandler.createGroundItem(c, NPCDrops.normalDrops.get(npcs[i].npcType)[random][1], npcs[i].absX, npcs[i].absY, NPCDrops.normalDrops.get(npcs[i].npcType)[random][1], c.playerId);				
				//Server.clanChat.handleLootShare(c, NPCDrops.normalDrops.get(npcs[i].npcType)[random][0], NPCDrops.normalDrops.get(npcs[i].npcType)[random][1]);
			}
		}	
		
	}</blockquote>

item.title: Barrows Bug
item.dc:creator: @Sessy_Pk3r Sessy Pk3r
item.description:
@Sessy_Pk3r wrote:

An array is an arrangement or list. If the index is out of bounds it means that the number you put doesn’t exist in the list. Your error is in your NPCHandler.java

Read full topic
